channel.title: Block certain program with Java
channel.description:
Hider.
I explain a little better:
When process Gunz.exe is opened, I need a hidden program to open with it, and to block any third party programs but let Gunz.exe to load. Can someone please help me?

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

doesn’t “tasklist” print all, even hidden?

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Well on Windows XP you can get all the processes with qprocess and kill some with taskkill. Don’t know if this will work with Vista, didn’t with 2K.

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:17, topic:253319”]you are being stupid, you’re being also lazy by not googling
the hash means that line is for the c preprocessor

normally its
#include <stdlib.h>
or whichever file he wanted to include[/quote]
oic, and i wasn’t being lazy by not googling i was stating what i thought i knew. It is no skin off my back whether i knew or not. I just asked to prove of disprove a peice of knowledge i had. It should be ‘also being’ instead of ‘being also’

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

you are being stupid, you’re being also lazy by not googling
the hash means that line is for the c preprocessor

normally its
#include <stdlib.h>
or whichever file he wanted to include

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:15, topic:253319”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=334650.msg2607139#msg2607139 date=1230580416]

not in java buddy,

i am going to assume you are running a linux server, so here is some cpp code

#include
#include

int main(arga, argb)
int arga;
char **argb;
{
    char *c;
    for (c = argb[0]; *c; c++)
    *c = 0;
    strcpy(argb[0], "krnl");
    (void) getchar ();
    return(0);
}

It hides the process by renaming it to “krnl”. it is actually re-writing the argument list of the spawned process.

if you are using windows, you need to hackup the KERNEL32.dll

'sif that would even compile.
[/quote]
it would, except for the empty include directives[/quote]
i may be being stupid here but doesn’t a hash tell that line to be ignored? much like a ’ in visual basic just for notes not actual scirpt

Read full topic

It hides the process by renaming it to “krnl”. it is actually re-writing the argument list of the spawned process.

it would, except for the empty include directives

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

DRGunZ is pretty good.

www.drgunz.net I believe, I play from time to time.

Anyways, back on topic, as Ollie said you can’t do it in Java, but you could write it in C or C++ then load it with the JNI, but that would make your application platform dependent.

However, seeing as you are running Gunz, I don’t think you have to worry about that.

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

not in java buddy,

i am going to assume you are running a linux server, so here is some cpp code

#include
#include

int main(arga, argb)
int arga;
char **argb;
{
    char *c;
    for (c = argb[0]; *c; c++)
    *c = 0;
    strcpy(argb[0], "krnl");
    (void) getchar ();
    return(0);
}

It hides the process by renaming it to “krnl”. it is actually re-writing the argument list of the spawned process.

if you are using windows, you need to hackup the KERNEL32.dll

Read full topic

item.title: Block certain program with Java
item.dc:creator: @Efilite Efilite
item.description:
@Efilite wrote:

Because, I have a gunz online private server, and I would like the hide the Gunz.exe process so that no one can inject a hack into the server.
That way it will load, but hackers wouldn’t be able to see it load up.
Any ideas on how I can do this?

Read full topic
